cleanSlateAutomatic.name: Clean Slate Automatic Sealing
cleanSlateAutomatic.description: Pennsylvania's automatic sealing process - no petition required for eligible records
eligibilityCriteria: Summary offense convictions with 5-year waiting period completed
Misdemeanor convictions with 10-year waiting period completed
Certain non-violent felony convictions with 10-year waiting period completed (2023 expansion)
No subsequent arrests during the applicable waiting period
cleanSlateAutomatic.waitingPeriod: Varies by offense type - see statute
process: Court system automatically identifies eligible records
System verifies waiting period and no subsequent arrests
Individual may verify sealing through PA State Police
cleanSlateAutomatic.fees: FREE - no cost to the individual

acquittalDismissal.name: Acquittal or Dismissal Expungement
acquittalDismissal.description: Expungement for charges resulting in acquittal or dismissal
acquittalDismissal.waitingPeriod: Immediate - may file petition right away
process: Obtain certified copy of acquittal/dismissal order
File with Clerk of Courts in county where case was heard
acquittalDismissal.fees: Filing fees vary by county ($0-$150); may be waived for indigent

ardCompletion.name: ARD (Accelerated Rehabilitative Disposition) Expungement
ardCompletion.description: Expungement for successful completion of Pennsylvania's ARD program
eligibilityCriteria: All ARD fees and costs paid
No new criminal charges during ARD period
ARD was for an eligible offense
process: Obtain ARD completion certificate from the court
Attach proof of completion and fee payment
File with Court of Common Pleas
ardCompletion.fees: Filing fees vary by county; ARD program fees already paid during program
ardCompletion.note: ARD is commonly used for first-time DUI offenders in Pennsylvania

summaryOffense.name: Summary Offense Expungement
summaryOffense.description: Petition-based expungement for summary offense convictions (Clean Slate also covers these automatically after 5 years)
eligibilityCriteria: Conviction for summary offense only (not misdemeanor or felony)
No arrests or convictions during waiting period
summaryOffense.waitingPeriod: 5 years from conviction or final discharge
process: Obtain proof of payment of all fines and costs
File with Magisterial District Court or Court of Common Pleas
summaryOffense.fees: Filing fees vary; may be waived
summaryOffense.note: Summary offenses may also be sealed automatically under Clean Slate

underageDrinking.name: Underage Drinking Expungement
underageDrinking.description: Special expungement provision for underage drinking convictions
eligibilityCriteria: No other convictions during the period
process: Verify you are at least 21 years old
Obtain proof of age and conviction records
File with Court of Common Pleas

humanTraffickingVictim.name: Human Trafficking Victim Expungement
humanTraffickingVictim.description: Expungement for victims of human trafficking convicted of offenses committed while trafficked
eligibilityCriteria: Conviction for offense committed while victim of human trafficking
humanTraffickingVictim.waitingPeriod: May file motion at any time after conviction
humanTraffickingVictim.note: Consult an attorney or victim services organization for assistance

nonViolentFelony.name: Non-Violent Felony Clean Slate Sealing
nonViolentFelony.description: 2023 expansion - automatic sealing for certain non-violent felony convictions
eligibilityCriteria: No subsequent arrests during waiting period
All court obligations satisfied (fines, restitution, probation)
nonViolentFelony.waitingPeriod: 10 years from final discharge of sentence
nonViolentFelony.note: One of the most progressive provisions in the nation

cleanSlateVerification: Pennsylvania State Police criminal record check
petitionBased: Complete copy of criminal record from PA State Police
Proof of payment of all fines, costs, and restitution
acquittalDismissal: Certified copy of acquittal order or dismissal order
Proof that case is fully closed

timelineFactors.impact: Automatic sealing may take several months due to system processing volume
Petition-based expungements may be delayed 30-60 days due to court schedules
If District Attorney objects, hearing will be required and timeline extended
Petitions with missing information will be rejected and must be refiled
Each county where charges exist requires separate verification or petition

options: Appeal to Superior Court within 30 days
Wait and refile if eligibility issues can be resolved
appealsProcess.note: Consult an attorney if your expungement petition is denied

countyVariations.note: Pennsylvania has 67 counties, each with a Court of Common Pleas
countyVariations.filingLocations: Petitions must be filed in the county where the charges originated
countyVariations.formVariations: Some counties have their own expungement petition forms
countyVariations.feeVariations: Filing fees vary significantly between counties

majorCounties.name: Philadelphia
majorCounties.characteristics: Largest court system; over 50% of PA expungements; dedicated expungement unit

majorCounties.name: Montgomery
majorCounties.characteristics: Suburban Philadelphia; moderate volume; standard procedures

howToCheck.description: Request criminal history record - sealed records will not appear
Check court docket - sealed cases will not be publicly accessible
Online court records portal - sealed records not visible

cleanSlateVerification.note: If sealed records still appear, contact the court or PA State Police
